domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Springwatch
entity.description: Following the fortunes of a cast of unforgettable wildlife characters at the climax of spring.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

An @EnvAgencyYNE flood warning is in force for Walsden Water. River levels across the Upper River Calder have risen and are now approaching levels where we expect properties to flood. Please take care and be prepared. Visit https://t.co/SOPqHGairw for advice. https://t.co/Xa21H6xf44

@RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Sorry I think I didn't make myself clear. I was on about road gullies.  Many haven't been cleaned for years so rain just dumps silt off the roads into watercourses and those drains are lost as an attenuation source.
